summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling previous relevant resolutions, particularly 242, 338, 1397 and Madrid principles,
Expressing grave concern at the continuation of violent events in the Middle East,
Demanding an immediate cessation of all acts of violence, including terrorism, provocation, incitement and destruction,
Reaffirming its vision of two States, Israel and Palestine, living side by side within secure borders,
Emphasizing the need for a comprehensive, just and lasting peace in the Middle East,
Welcoming the diplomatic efforts of the international Quartet,
 Endorses the Quartet's Performance-based Roadmap to a Permanent Two-State Solution; 
Calls on parties to fulfil Roadmap obligations in cooperation with the Quartet; 
Decides to remain seized of the matter.
